body_html:
@aaronzs

  • According to your method, I have successfully modified. Thank you!

  • I changed line 204 and line 210 of mnist_with_summaries.py to the local directories, and I created some folders.

  • OR, don't change the code, and I created some folders in the local disk where is the running environment according to the code.

    • line 204: create /tmp/tensorflow/mnist/input_data

    • line 210: create /tmp/tensorflow/mnist/logs/mnist_with_summaries

  • OR, I only changed the \tmp to ., and it created those folders in the local disk as mnist_with_summaries.py automatically. (tensorflow/mnist/input_data and tensorflow/mnist/logs/mnist_with_summaries)
body_text:
@aaronzs


According to your method, I have successfully modified. Thank you!


I changed line 204 and line 210 of mnist_with_summaries.py to the local directories, and I created some folders.


OR, don't change the code, and I created some folders in the local disk where is the running environment according to the code.


line 204: create /tmp/tensorflow/mnist/input_data


line 210: create /tmp/tensorflow/mnist/logs/mnist_with_summaries




OR, I only changed the \tmp to ., and it created those folders in the local disk as mnist_with_summaries.py automatically.  (tensorflow/mnist/input_data and tensorflow/mnist/logs/mnist_with_summaries)
body:
@aaronzs 

- According to your method, I have successfully modified. Thank you! 

- I changed _line 204_ and _line 210_ of _mnist_with_summaries.py_ to the _local directories_, and I created some folders.
- **OR**, don't change the code, and I created some folders in the local disk where is the running environment according to the code. 

  -  line 204: create _/tmp/tensorflow/mnist/input_data_  

  -  line 210: _create /tmp/tensorflow/mnist/logs/mnist_with_summaries_
- **OR**, I only changed the` \tmp` to` .`, and it created those folders in the local disk as mnist_with_summaries.py automatically.  (_tensorflow/mnist/input_data_ and _tensorflow/mnist/logs/mnist_with_summaries_)
